comments.content:
**Correction**

1. Click the OSPF toggle to enable OSPF
2. In the Area Definition field, click Set to add an area definition

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/3.2/administration/GUID-5BEC626C-5312-467D-B873-8E117349E9FC.html

discussion.content:
Area Definition & OSPF Configured Interfaces

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/3.2/administration/GUID-5BEC626C-5312-467D-B873-8E117349E9FC.html

Since OSPF is already enabled, which means Routing and Interfaces are already set.
While in the enabled OSPF section next thing would be to do: 1. Area Definition - Add area Definition and then 2. OSPF Configured Interfaces - Click Set

You need to enable OSPF (already enabled), set the Area Definition and configure the interfaces. The anwser is 'Area Definition' and 'OSPF Configured Interfaces'. I saw that on multiple diffrent exam preps as well.

OSPF configured interfaces "set" is black. this means that no existing external interface is defined on the GW. Could just be a bad image but based on this you would need to click interfaces and add the external interface first, then set the area definition under OSPF before you would be able to set the OSPF configured interfaces.

I think that
1. Enable OSPF 
2. Set Area Definition.
Erea Definition & OSPF configured interfaces
must be interface and area
